data.title: Green Goods Product Development

data.name: Gitcoin
data.description: Gitcoin creates solutions that empower digitally native communities to fund, build, and protect what matters.

questions.query: How does your project contribute to the advancement of the Web3 grants ecosystem?
questions.explanation: Experiments with innovative funding mechanisms

questions.query: Describe your previous work or plans related to the Web3 grants ecosystem.
questions.explanation: Currently, we are funding regenerative games through a unique model called Grant Ships, which incorporates a pro-retroactive funding strategy. This model allows us to reward past achievements while incentivizing future innovations. We are pioneering proactive and retroactive funding models within grants and bounties, which provide flexibility and encourage creativity among participants. Additionally, we are experimenting with hackathon models that include a proactive funding element, enabling participants to access resources early on and focus on building impactful projects.

questions.query: How does your project create value for the Web3 grants ecosystem?
questions.explanation: Our project creates value for the Web3 grants ecosystem by pioneering new funding mechanisms that challenge traditional paradigms. We are participating in experimental Grant Round mechanisms, testing and refining innovative approaches that have the potential to transform how projects are funded and developed in the Web3 space.

questions.query: Describe your team's expertise in your chosen focus area within Web3 grants. Include relevant experience, publications, or past projects.
questions.explanation: Our team comprises Grants Stack Round manager trainees who bring a wealth of expertise to our focus area within Web3 grants. We have gained valuable experience by working with Grant Ships in round 1, utilizing a forked Allo contract. This experience has equipped us with the skills and knowledge necessary to drive meaningful contributions to the Web3 grants ecosystem.

questions.query: How do you plan to share insights, methodologies, or tools developed through your project with the Cartographer Syndicate and the broader Web3 grants community?
questions.explanation: We plan to share insights, methodologies, and tools developed through our project with the Cartographer Syndicate and the broader Web3 grants community by reaching out for one-on-one calls to foster collaboration and knowledge exchange. Additionally, we will host community calls and workshops to discuss the methodologies our Guild is using within Grant Ships and Guild bounties. We will also create forum posts to update the community on our projects and propose new ideas based on our experiments, ensuring transparency and encouraging feedback.

questions.query: How does your project contribute to the advancement of the Arbitrum ecosystem?
questions.explanation: dApps & Apps

questions.query: Describe your previous work or plans related to the Arbitrum ecosystem. How does your project strengthen Arbitrum's foundational infrastructure, improve developer efficiency, or accelerate the adoption of novel applications?
questions.explanation: Our past engagement with the Arbitrum ecosystem includes launching the first round of "Grant Ships," a gamified funding competition where teams strategically allocate funds to gaming projects​​. This initiative successfully supported four regenerative games, earning us a community vote victory and additional funding for the second round. Furthermore, we are developing "Green Goods," a project that brings biodiversity data on-chain to improve impact measurement, tracking, and reward systems​​. This project aims to strengthen Arbitrum's foundational infrastructure by integrating environmental data and empowering local communities, gardeners, and data scientists​​.

questions.query: If applicable, describe how your project leverages Stylus or Arbitrum Orbit Chains. What unique capabilities or use cases does this enable?
questions.explanation: N/A

questions.query: Describe your team's expertise in your chosen focus area within the Arbitrum ecosystem. Include relevant experience, publications, or past projects.
questions.explanation: Our team at the Greenpill Dev Guild boasts extensive experience in regenerative actions and decentralized applications (Dapps)​​. With our Greenpill background, we have consistently demonstrated our commitment to building impactful regenerative applications. Our team comprises experts in engineering, product development, and design, enabling us to create robust, user-centric products. This diverse skill set ensures we can effectively contribute to the Arbitrum ecosystem by developing innovative solutions that drive sustainability and engagement​​.

questions.query: List any contract addresses with the associated network(s), EOAs, or deployer addresses your project has deployed.
questions.explanation: N/A

questions.query: Have you received any previous grants or support for your work in the Arbitrum ecosystem? If so, please provide details and estimated funding amounts.
questions.explanation: N/A

questions.query: Would you like to share anything else about your project, team, or vision for the Arbitrum ecosystem that wasn't covered in the previous questions?
questions.explanation: N/A

questions.query: If applicable, describe how your project/community has been utilising or supporting the Celo ecosystem, or explain a roadmap for your plans to utilise, build with, or align with Celo.
questions.explanation: A couple of our members Coi and Athus have been active builders on Celo with the Silvi Protocol. We as a guild actively plan to explore Celo opportunities that align with our projects and are optimistic for future engagement.

data.title: Karma Gap Workshop
data.description:
Host a workshop in partnership with KarmaGap to showcase the platform’s features, address user questions, provide technical support, and facilitate an interactive Miro activity.

Based on recent polls, our community is eager to learn more about this onchain tool. KarmaGap provides verifiable evidence of work accomplished. Therefore it reinforces the relevance of a project in grant applications. A date is yet to be determined but we’re planning on holding a KarmaGap workshop later in October.

**Measurable Outcomes**

- Numbers of POAPs minted by attendees
- Social media sharing and engagement with workshop materials

data.reason:
On November 21, we hosted an in-depth Google Meet workshop led by KarmaGap founder Mahesh and Dev Guild Steward Afo. Participants engaged in hands-on activities and received technical assistance to fully leverage KarmaGap’s capabilities for their projects.

![Karma Gap Workshop Screenshot](https://cdn.charmverse.io/user-content/5e36d65b-e9d7-4667-b1c7-f551832414e3/d26936e8-a649-4497-9ea7-8f006a398c94/Screenshot-2024-12-21-at-15.15.01.png)

**Proof**

- [KarmaGap Workshop Doc](https://app.charmverse.io/greenpill-dev-guild/october-karmagap-workshop-8701756406619892)
- [Luma event](https://lu.ma/join/g-Ic6DDOTIbZsUreo)
- [POAP](https://collectors.poap.xyz/token/7261582)

data.name: Regen Coordination
data.description: The Regen Coordination Round is a proposal for a GG21 community round centered on the themes of Coordi-nations 3, Cosmo-localism 2, Bio-Regionalism 3, and Regenerative Finance (ReFi) 3. Bringing together GreenPill Network 1, ReFi DAO 1, Celo Regional DAOs 1 and Regens Unite 1, we aim to support a global movement of regenerative communities leveraging Web3 for real-world impact and addressing local needs. The round will feed into a program to support the further development of local community impact tracking methodologies, grant tooling interoperability, and integrated QF & RPGF. We have currently secured $60K in funding from Celo Public Goods, ReFi DAO and Greenpill and ask for Gitcoin’s backing as we embark on a shared mission to showcase how community coordination, Web3, and innovative financial mechanisms can enable ecological and social regeneration on a global scale.

questions.query: If you've participated in past grant rounds, please share any new updates or milestones from the prior months (N/A if you are yet to participate).
questions.explanation: Since the last round we have completed a ReFi in Arbitrum grant for Green Goods (bringing biodiversity data onchain to better measure, track and reward impact).  We have also finished 2 grant rounds with GrantShips funding 5 blockchain games to build regenerative features within their game. Lastly we are on track to launch Impact Reef (simplifying the evaluation process by providing qualitative data of public good impact) in the upcoming Optimism round.

questions.query: Have you participated in any Octant epoch (Epoch 0 through Epoch 4) OR a previous Gitcoin Grants round? Please provide details and evidence of your participation.
questions.explanation:
Yes, we’ve actively participated in the following Gitcoin Grants rounds:

- GG21 Thriving Arbitrum: https://explorer.gitcoin.co/#/round/42161/389/50
- GG21 Web3 Grant Ecosystem: https://explorer.gitcoin.co/#/round/42161/385/70 
- GG21 Regen Coordi-Nation Genesis: https://explorer.gitcoin.co/#/round/42220/14/9
- GG20 Apps & dApps: https://builder.gitcoin.co/#/chains/42161/25

questions.query: Please describe how your project contributes to the growth and development of the Octant ecosystem.
questions.explanation: Our project drives growth in the Octant ecosystem through educational workshops on the grant ecosystem and application processes, distributing GLM to core members and new participants, staking GLM via the guild treasury, and collaborating with the Octant team on Greenpill initiatives.

questions.query: How does your project align with the round's focus on community and education within the Octant ecosystem?
questions.explanation: We prioritize open-source, regenerative projects, building Greenpill chapters and community structures while onboarding individuals into Octant to support public good projects.

questions.query: Provide a clear roadmap of your project, detailing future milestones and deliverables. How does this demonstrate your commitment to long-term impact and growth within the Octant ecosystem?
questions.explanation:
We plan to:

- Conduct Grant Workshops focused on Octant and application strategies.
- Organize Octant Staking Workshops for the Greenpill community to teach staking of GLM.

questions.query: Describe your team's expertise and how it contributes to the successful execution of your project.
questions.explanation: Our team consists of experienced Greenpill builders with deep knowledge of staking, wallets, and other web3 technologies. Core members have hosted numerous workshops and events, fostering community growth and engagement.

questions.query: How does your project complement or enhance existing initiatives within the Octant ecosystem rather than competing directly against them?
questions.explanation: We plan to enhance the Octant ecosystem by supporting Ecosynthesis with tools to capture impact in cleanup initiatives, collaborating with MetaGame to develop regenerative guides and playbooks, integrating Passport.xyz for sybil resistance in our products, and partnering with Octant on initiatives that promote staking and engagement with Octant projects.

questions.query: Describe your approach to community engagement and how you plan to contribute to a collaborative and constructive funding environment.
questions.explanation: We host weekly calls to discuss Octant initiatives, provide updates, gather feedback, and run workshops. Participants earn credentials and tokens for completing workshops, fostering active participation and feedback.

questions.query: How do you plan to use the funding to maximize your project's ongoing impact within the Octant ecosystem if selected?
questions.explanation: Funding will be allocated to staking GLM, creating bounties for tools that ease Octant/GLM onboarding, and hosting workshops where we distribute funds to active participants and hosts.

questions.query: What unique educational content or resources have you created for the Octant ecosystem? How has the community received these? Please share any relevant links
questions.explanation: We’ve onboarded Greenpill community members into Octant by sharing relevant content such as Loom videos and Notion pages during calls, supporting them in staking and understanding the reward processes.

data.title: Passport for Octant Workshop
data.description:
Host workshop helping onboard user into Octant by understanding the requirements for a fully matched donation with Passport.xyz.

**Measurable Outcomes**

- Workshop hosted on Google Meet
- Workshop resources created for attendees

data.reason:
We hosted a workshop for the community on October 20th teaching attendees about Passport and it's relevance to the Octant ecosystem. We were joined by Daniel from the Passport team who provided key insights into Passport development and provided technical support.

data.name: Octant
data.description: Octant is a platform that enables users to lock GLM, earn ETH rewards, and fund projects they care about.

## Welcome to the ReFi in Arbitrum Grants Program!
>
> 
>
> **📅 Key Dates:**
>
> - **June 14, 2024**: Wave 1 applications open.
>
> - **June 28, 2024**: Deadline for Wave 1 applications. **APPLICATION DEADLINE: 23:59 UTC**
>
> - **July 1 - July 10**: Evaluation period
>
> - **July 12, 2024**: Winners announced; approved projects can kickstart their missions!
>
> ### Apply Here 👉  

## What is the ReFi in Arbitrum Grants Program?

> The ReFi in Arbitrum Grants Program aims to attract and onboard new builders into the Arbitrum ecosystem by leveraging the transformative potential of Regenerative Finance (ReFi) communities. **By aligning financial mechanisms towards regeneration rather than extraction or exploitation**, ReFi projects focus on initiatives that positively impact areas such as sequestered, verifiable carbon credits., regenerative farming, and microloan projects while achieving positive financial outcomes.

Recognizing the untapped potential of ReFi within Arbitrum, this program seeks to expand the ecosystem by proactively funding ReFi projects that not only benefit the Arbitrum network but also contribute to global sustainability efforts.

**Key objectives of the program include:**

- Builder Attraction and Retention: Encouraging new builders to join and remain active in the Arbitrum ecosystem.

- Ecosystem Expansion: Bringing new wallets and users to Arbitrum, thereby broadening its user base. 

- Impactful Projects: Supporting projects that deliver significant benefits to the Arbitrum ecosystem while also addressing global challenges. 

_Fifteen teams will be awarded grants of **20K ARB** each_. To qualify, projects must clearly benefit the Arbitrum ecosystem while also delivering significant environmental and social impacts. This program prioritizes initiatives that drive both ecosystem growth and global sustainability, ensuring a dual impact that advances Arbitrum's evolution and contributes to a better world.

Join us in fueling the growth of Arbitrum by harnessing the innovative power of ReFi and building a more sustainable future.

[](https://cdn.charmverse.io/user-content/5456438a-8f49-4ad1-bbb2-4a9ef884e323/bcc0dd63-6d75-4d6e-8532-4d3303d5a584/arb-x-little-trees-(2).png)

## Eligibility Criteria for the ReFi in Arbitrum Grants Program

**Project Relevance** 

Alignment with ReFi Principles: The project must align with the principles of Regenerative Finance (ReFi), focusing on climate change, conservation and biodiversity initiatives that emphasize regeneration over extraction or exploitation and create a more equitable and sustainable financial system.

Environmental and Social Impact: The project should have a demonstrable positive impact on areas included in the [Grant Program funding categories](https://app.charmverse.io/refi-in-arbitrum-grants/request-for-grants-305496252245016).

**Arbitrum Ecosystem Contribution** 

Benefit to Arbitrum: The project must clearly outline how it will benefit the Arbitrum ecosystem, including but not limited to increasing user engagement, expanding the network, or enhancing the blockchain's capabilities. 

Ecosystem Growth: Projects should contribute to the growth of the Arbitrum ecosystem by attracting new builders, users, and wallets.

**Project Viability** 

Clear Objectives: The project must have clearly defined goals and objectives, with a focus on both short-term and long-term impacts. 

Feasibility: There must be a realistic and well-documented plan for project execution, including timelines, milestones, and resource requirements.

**Innovation & Originality** 

Innovative Solutions: The project should offer innovative solutions or approaches to current environmen**tal or financial challenges.** Projects are encouraged to leverage existing projects and core infrastructure on Arbitrum to build new innovative tools.

Originality: Preference will be given to original projects that introduce novel ideas or methodologies into the Arbitrum ecosystem.

**Team Capability** 

Experienced Team: The team should have relevant experience and expertise in their respective fields, demonstrating their ability to execute the project successfully. 

Commitment to Arbitrum: Teams must show a commitment to participate in and contribute to the Arbitrum ecosystem actively.

**Sustainability & Longevity** 

Long-Term Impact: Projects should aim for long-term sustainability and have a plan for maintaining and scaling their impact beyond the initial funding period. 

Sustainable Practices: Projects must employ sustainable practices in their operations and objectives, ensuring ongoing positive environmental and social outcomes.

**Measurable Outcomes** 

Impact Metrics: The project must include measurable outcomes to assess its impact on both the Arbitrum ecosystem and global sustainability efforts. 

Reporting and Transparency: Projects must commit to providing regular and consistent milestone updates and impact metrics, detailing progress and justifying the distribution of funds. This includes setting clear, achievable milestones and timelines.

**User Retention & Community Engagement**

Demonstrated Support: The project should actively engage with the community to ensure inclusive development and adoption. 

User Engagement Strategies: Projects should outline strategies for retaining users within the Arbitrum ecosystem. This can include continuous value addition, community engagement initiatives, and user-friendly interfaces.

**Know Your Customer (KYC) Requirements** 

Applicants must comply with Thank ARB and Arbitrum KYC regulations to verify their identity and legitimacy. This may include:

- Personal Identification: Submission of a government-issued photo ID (e.g., passport, driver's license).

- Organization Identification: Submission of legal documents proving the existence of the organization (e.g., articles of incorporation, tax identification number). 

- Contact Information: Valid and verifiable email address, phone number, and physical 

- Geographical Limitations: The program is open to applicants globally, except for individuals and entities from countries currently under sanctions by the issuing organization’s country or international bodies (e.g., United Nations, European Union).

**Funding Cap** Maximum Previous Funding: Projects that have already raised a significant amount of funding may be subject to eligibility restrictions.

- Projects that have already raised more than $1 million in funding from investors, grants, or other sources are not eligible for this grant. 

- Applicants must provide detailed financial information, including a list of all funding sources and amounts raised to date. 

- This information will be used to ensure that the grants are awarded to projects that are in greater need of financial support.

**Proof of Past Work and Experience** 

Previous Projects: Applicants must provide evidence of past work relevant to the grant’s focus area. eg: GitHub

---
data.title: ReFi on Arbitrium
Green Goods August Community Event
data.description:
Host a community event in Rio Claro, Brazil to remove invasive species, plant native trees and document local flora. Reward attendees with community tokens and a food basket.

**Measurable Outcomes**: 

- Community engagement stories and collect feedback from participants. 
- Workshop feedback from the event
- Have at least 10 participants and community tokens minted
- Number of gardeners in the WhatsApp group

data.reason:
On August 25, 2024, we hosted a community event in Rio Claro, Brazil. Despite the rain, we had six participants (nine including children) who contributed to removing invasive species, planting native and exotic trees, and documenting local flora. Although we initially aimed for 10-15 participants, the weather limited turnout. As part of the event, we minted 16 community tokens for attendees and other local residents.

During the event, we cleared 40m² of invasive Leucaena, planted six trees (including jambo, ingá, uvaia, banana, and avocado), and documented additional species. Participants who held community tokens were rewarded with baskets of organic and artisanal foods, further incentivizing ongoing community engagement.

**Funds**

- **Designs**: Outreach materials and visuals were created to promote participation and community engagement.
- **Software Development**: Tools were developed to onboard participants and mint community tokens using NFT technology.
- **Community Outreach**: Workshops and events were held to involve local residents.
-** Rewards**: Community tokens were distributed as participation incentives, redeemable for a basket of local organic foods.

**Outcomes**

- **Community Engagement**: The event strengthened community ties and raised environmental awareness. Participants reported feeling more connected to local biodiversity efforts and expressed interest in future activities.
- **Behavioral Impact**: Several participants committed to continuing the removal of invasive species and planting native trees in their own spaces, extending the impact beyond the event.
- **Economic and Social Impact**: The distribution of organic and artisanal food baskets provided immediate rewards to participants, supported local food producers, and reinforced the value of community-driven conservation efforts.
- **Participants**: 6 new gardeners
- **WhatsApp Group**: 6 new members
- **Tokens Minted**: 16 community tokens
- **Workshops**: 1 event completed, focused on invasive species management and tree planting

**Links**

- [Event Report](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1zWv9K1P627V7YQIIIQPlgb76LBr3c8Td4J-BHpAm7UE/edit?usp=sharing)
- [Social Proof on X](https://x.com/greengoodsapp/status/1828816445519843765?t=fPC42DFq4ZWs2oXXDn7kpg&s=19)
- [Community Token Contract](https://arbiscan.io/token/0x633d825006e4c659b061db7fb9378edee8bd95f3)
- [Event Expenses](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1gC7T-ZPLtZ9SejpyVATci4weUGlkpRJoUMdIhLTgnYE/edit?usp=sharing)

data.title: Green Goods PWA Interface
data.description:
Create the PWA interface for Green Goods, allowing users to install the app on their phones.

**Measurable Outcome**

- User feedback on the PWA and installation experience 
- Github repository with source code for project
- Deploy progressive web app to https://greengoods.app

**Relevant Links**

data.reason:

data.title: Brazil Garden Assessment
data.description:
Map the pilot garden and capture various metrics to evaluate and monitor the impact of interventions, utilizing data from databases to establish a baseline for future assessments.

**Measurable Outcome**

- Detailed environmental map and garden assessment report recorded onchain
- Map the garden and utilize key biodiversity metrics
- Deploy Garden Assessment Schemas
- Attest with Garden Assessment data
- Deploy pilot garden smart account
- Deploy smart accounts for gardeners

data.reason:
We have completed the assessment of our first garden in Rio Claro, São Paulo, and deployed the necessary on-chain contracts and attestations to support the evaluation.

**Fund Usage**

- Integrated GIS with on-ground data
- Deployed schemas and contracts for assessments
- Established carbon and biodiversity baselines using Google Earth Engine
- Conducted on-ground biodiversity and carbon inventories
- Performed data cleaning and analysis

**Progress & Highlights**

- Area Covered: 2.62 ha with detailed NDVI and land cover metrics
- Invasive Species: 1.54 ha (58.75%) dominated by Leucaena
- Carbon Stock: ~500 tonnes, with a potential of 60 t/ha
- Biodiversity: Completed inventory of native and invasive species

**Additional Achievements**

- Deployed Garden Smart Account linked to unique garden identifiers
- Integrated schema for garden assessments
- Submitted and verified attestations of the garden’s current state

**Links**

- [Garden Assessment Pull Request](https://github.com/greenpill-dev-guild/green-goods/pull/78)
- [Garden Account](https://arbiscan.io/address/0x3307e5392215f63189081ba49611eb7e1c5dabae)
- [Garden Assessment Schema](https://arbitrum.easscan.org/schema/view/0x7433e24287be826b49e5eb28cd52192823e542521c94084a691e67e5cc7e8176)
- [Garden Assessment Attestation](https://arbitrum.easscan.org/attestation/view/0x8175d56c30cd5d12679cfd61cef127dd9e7d117db76bc065d20e34ceb6337e88)
- [Remote Report](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ZnHm_Qi_ydn9rixlse4XQjVRfQ5Ed-psoGj3Nb7kEJM/edit?usp=sharing)

![Green Goods Observation](https://cdn.charmverse.io/user-content/ac22a202-547a-4ee0-96b5-5b50858e5ab3/3073ed31-df54-47f5-a829-55a389fcd990/gardenasses.png)

![Green Goods Remote Map](https://cdn.charmverse.io/user-content/ac22a202-547a-4ee0-96b5-5b50858e5ab3/60e239b5-da8d-49ac-9236-3ba37e05c885/garden1.png)

**Fund Usage**

- Integrated GIS with on-ground data
- Deployed schemas and contracts for assessments
- Established carbon and biodiversity baselines using Google Earth Engine
- Conducted on-ground biodiversity and carbon inventories
- Performed data cleaning and analysis

**Progress & Highlights**

- Area Covered: 2.62 ha with detailed NDVI and land cover metrics
- Invasive Species: 1.54 ha (58.75%) dominated by Leucaena
- Carbon Stock: ~500 tonnes, with a potential of 60 t/ha
- Biodiversity: Completed inventory of native and invasive species

**Additional Achievements**

- Deployed Garden Smart Account linked to unique garden identifiers
- Integrated schema for garden assessments
- Submitted and verified attestations of the garden’s current state

**Links**

data.text: This grant provided a valuable learning experience, as we quickly adapted to shifting deadlines while focusing on delivering essential features that empower gardeners to bring biodiversity onchain. We successfully brought the first set of attestations onchain for garden work and assessments. Additionally, we hosted a Twitter Space with Charmverse, where we discussed our journey with the grant and shared our future vision for Green Goods and the broader regen finance space.

data.name: Arbitrum
data.description: EVM L2 network

With the Epoch Five submission deadline coming up on 15 August, here's a step-by-step guide to help you navigate the process.

## What We Fund
At Octant, we're all about funding projects that can make a real difference in their ecosystems. Here are the main areas we focus on:

- Enhancing Core Ethereum Technology: Supporting infrastructure and advancements in Ethereum.
- Advancing Pro-Privacy and Censorship-Resistant Technologies: Promoting technologies that enhance privacy and resist censorship.
- Developing Web3 Public Goods: Investing in infrastructure and tools that foster innovation in web3.
- Supporting Golem Network Use Cases: Backing projects that leverage the Golem Network to promote community-driven initiatives.

If your project aligns with these goals, there's a good chance it'll resonate with the Octant community and have a strong shot at getting funded.

## Is Your Project Eligible?

To be eligible, your project must be:

- Open-source
- Transparent
- Respect privacy
- and have the potential to make a big impact.

Projects that are for-profit, financial products, or distributing funding through user voting mechanisms won't qualify. For detailed guidelines, check the Octant Docs.
data.title: Octant - Epoch 5
Impact Reef - QA (Quality Analysis)
data.description:
Complete QA for the Impact Reef prototype, advancing the app to the Alpha stage.

**Measurable Outcomes**

- Bugs documented on GitHub
- Issues tracked and prioritized for bug fixes
- Code branches merged with bug fixes
- Staging environment to validate bug fixes

data.reason:
We successfully completed QA of Impact Reef over a month long period of time. The initial half of the month we focused on documenting and finding bugs by stress testing the website. After surfacing bugs we triaged them on our Github bug board and assigned them as task for our engineering team to complete. Bugs were successfully fixed and now ready to progress to the next phase of testing.

**Proof**

- [GitHub Bug Board](https://github.com/orgs/greenpill-dev-guild/projects/9/views/7?filterQuery=bug)
- [Release Branch](https://github.com/greenpill-dev-guild/impact-reef/tree/release/november)
- [Impact Reef App](https://impactreef.app)

data.title: Dev Guild Weekly Call
data.description:
Host a weekly call for regen builders to connect, share ideas and learn about the Dev Guild.

**Measurable Outcome**

- Social media post sharing meeting agenda
- Recordings of weekly calls uploaded on YouTube

data.reason:
We held a weekly call every Tuesday from early 2024 through December 17, with one week off in November for Thanksgiving. On October 24, we celebrated our anniversary of calls—a significant milestone highlighting the program’s success. All calls from August onward have been uploaded to YouTube for anyone interested in the Dev Guild.

data.description:
Host a monthly Twitter Space featuring various regen builders to learn about their web3 regen experiences and what they're working on.

data.title: Github Organization
data.description:
Build a GitHub organization with active project development and contributors.

**Measurable Outcome**

- Workspace with over 20 members
- Track project on GitHub with project board
- Code for projects in GitHub repositories

data.reason:
We established a well-structured GitHub organization with more than 20 contributors throughout the year. A cohesive Story and Bug board was created to efficiently track issues across all projects. We also introduced issue templates to simplify bug reporting and task creation, along with README files detailing our Code of Conduct, Contributor Guidelines, Governance, and Security practices. Lastly, we implemented a story point system to more accurately value retroactive payments.

**Proof**

- [Dev Guild Story Board](https://github.com/orgs/greenpill-dev-guild/projects/13)
- [Github Templates](https://github.com/greenpill-dev-guild/.github)
- [Github Teams](https://github.com/orgs/greenpill-dev-guild/teams)

data.name: Giveth
data.description: Zero-fee crypto donation platform that rewards donors to verified public goods projects. Donate to a verified project & get rewarded.

## Delegate Mission Request Summary

Update and expand the Impact Evaluation Framework 22 based on the new intents set for Season 5 and diversify access to the Metrics Garden 17 through new interfaces. This will increase the adoption of existing Impact Metrics and leverage existing and new tools to demonstrate impact, enhancing the collective’s ability to identify and support impactful contributions.

## S5 Intent

This Request aligns with Intent 4:

- Educate the broader community about Optimism governance and RetroPGF
- Increase the resiliency of core governance infrastructure
- Create user interfaces to interact with governance programs.
- Create transparency and accountability for governance participants

data.text:
Thought for a few seconds

Certainly! Here’s a polished version of your text:

We are grateful to the Optimism Foundation and LauNaMu for selecting us as one of the grant recipients for this mission. The initial goal was to bring Metrics Garden on-chain and simplify the evaluation process for OP RetroPGF rounds. However, as we began working toward our objective, the scope shifted due to new decisions by the Optimism Grant Council regarding project applications for rounds. This required us to modify our API multiple times to accommodate the changes in project fetching.

Additionally, the evaluation process with metrics became the focus of a separate mission request for an Optimism Badgeholder voting interface, which rendered our original focus obsolete. In response, we shifted our efforts to endorsements and providing valuable qualitative data for Optimism projects. We believe that this new focus will allow us to engage with the Optimism, Greenpill, and other regen communities to gather high-quality endorsements for both projects and individuals.

We’re excited to continue building Impact Reef and finding synergy points with other communities within this diverse ecosystem.

data.name: Optimism
data.description: OP Mainnet is a Layer 2 Optimistic Rollup network designed to utilize the strong security guarantees of Ethereum while reducing its cost and latency.

The GreenPill Network and Octant are partnering to support community-driven initiatives that impact their local communities. GreenPill exports regenerative digital infrastructure globally through its local chapters, guilds, podcast, book and educational trainings. Octant is committed to supporting public goods and empowering communities to fund what is critical to them. Join us in supporting these regenerative projects.
data.title: GreenPill x Octant Community Round

data.reason: We created a 2 page onboarding flow on Charmverse where individuals can learn about the structure and roles in the guild. After completing the onboarding material we created a detailed post on the [Greenpill Hub](https://hub.greenpill.network/t/greenpill-dev-guild-q1-q2-update/79) introducing and providing context for the onboarding material.

We created a 2 page onboarding flow on Charmverse where individuals can learn about the structure and roles in the guild. After completing the onboarding material we created a detailed post on the [Greenpill Hub](https://hub.greenpill.network/t/greenpill-dev-guild-q1-q2-update/79) introducing and providing context for the onboarding material.

data.text: As our 1st grant received our main focus was setting milestones that supported the growth of the Dev Guild in the most minimal and cost effective manner. We set some product development goals that in hindsight were not feasible due to the limited funds earned from the round. However, the funds were enough to support in getting access to tools such as ChatGPT which were crucial in helping us polish and complete our onboarding material.

data.title: Allo Yeeter - UI Interface & Contracts
data.description:
Build an application using a custom Allo strategy to allocate and distribute funds to multiple recipients in a few steps.

**Measurable Outcome**

- App deployed to a dedicated domain
- Code branch showcasing development progress

data.reason:
The Dev team, led by Julian and Lawal, successfully completed both the contract and UI code for the app. Julian demonstrated a working MVP/initial Yeeter product during a sync meeting and Gitcoin’s office hours.

**Proof**

- [First production release on Github](https://github.com/greenpill-dev-guild/allo-yeeter/deployments/Production)
- [Allo Yeeter App](https://allo-yeeter.vercel.app/)

data.title: Allo Yeeter - UI Designs
data.description:
Create desktop 1st designs based on wireframes provided in RFP.

**Measurable Outcome**

- Figma designs illustrating user flow
- Prototype performing key features

data.reason:
One of our core designers, Marcus, refined the existing wireframes to create a clean, minimal desktop UI for the Yeet app. The design focuses on clarity, efficiency, and a streamlined user experience.

**Proofs**

- [Figma designs](https://www.figma.com/design/oZt0WBUNECuaZKJxhRKP5W/Allo-Yeeter?m=auto&t=7DtZXW5XnVoXPDfq-1)
- [Github Design Task](https://github.com/greenpill-dev-guild/allo-yeeter/issues/2)

questions.query: Have you participated in a previous Gitcoin Grants Round? If so, please name the rounds or link the builder profile associated with previous rounds.
questions.explanation: N/A

questions.query: How does your project contribute to the growth of the OSS ecosystem? Please provide specific examples of how your application enhances or expands the current ecosystem.
questions.explanation: The Greenpill Dev Guild actively develops decentralized applications (dApps) to advance the regen ecosystem, emphasizing capital allocation, community coordination, and impact measurement. Our suite of tools addresses these core areas; ranging from Green Goods, which supports local gardeners in Brazil to validate and amplify their biodiversity efforts onchain, to Community Host, an AI-powered agent designed to ease administrative workloads while providing a seamless onboarding experience into web3 communities.

questions.query: What features or use cases does your dApp/App present? How is it differentiated?
questions.explanation:
- **Allo Yeeter**: A streamlined app leveraging the Allo Protocol to efficiently distribute funds to multiple recipients.
- **Green Goods**: Bringing biodiversity onchain through verifiable attestations to amplify ecological impact.
- **Community Host**: An AI-powered agent designed to enhance onboarding experiences within web3 communities.

questions.query: What are your plans for further development, and how will the grant funds be used to achieve these goals?
questions.explanation: We plan to allocate these funds toward supporting the operations of the Dev Guild, enabling our team to concentrate fully on developing impactful dApps and securing additional funding dedicated specifically to these projects.

questions.query: For any project deploying smart contracts on blockchain networks, please list all your deployer addresses and their corresponding blockchain networks. Use this format for each entry: [deployer_address], [chain_id]—for example, 0x123abc..., 42161 (This represents a deployer address on the Arbitrum network). Please include a separate line for each unique deployer address and blockchain combination.

questions.query: Team Size
Is your project a member or past grantee of one of these networks?
questions.explanation: Greenpill

questions.query: What are your key active goals, plans, objectives or milestones for this year?
questions.explanation:
The Greenpill Dev Guild remains dedicated to actively strengthening and advancing its three core pillars: **Community Coordination**, **Capital Allocation**, and **Impact Measurement**.

### Q2-Q3 Goals

- **Pilot Green Goods** across various Greenpill Chapters, enhancing community engagement and regenerative outcomes.
- **Integrate Allo Yeeter on Celo**, enabling effective grant round disbursement and supporting utilization by Celo Regional Hubs.
- **Refine GreenWill** into a robust platform for tracking Greenpill activities and reputation, incorporating seamless integration within the Prosperity Passport ecosystem.
- **Launch Community Host**, an AI-driven agent supporting onboarding, NFT minting, and knowledge sharing across regenerative communities.
- **Expand Squad Staking**, fostering passive revenue streams for Guild and Network community members, thereby strengthening overall economic resilience.

data.name: Regen Coordination
data.description: The Regen Coordination Round is a proposal for a GG21 community round centered on the themes of Coordi-nations 3, Cosmo-localism 2, Bio-Regionalism 3, and Regenerative Finance (ReFi) 3. Bringing together GreenPill Network 1, ReFi DAO 1, Celo Regional DAOs 1 and Regens Unite 1, we aim to support a global movement of regenerative communities leveraging Web3 for real-world impact and addressing local needs. The round will feed into a program to support the further development of local community impact tracking methodologies, grant tooling interoperability, and integrated QF & RPGF. We have currently secured $60K in funding from Celo Public Goods, ReFi DAO and Greenpill and ask for Gitcoin’s backing as we embark on a shared mission to showcase how community coordination, Web3, and innovative financial mechanisms can enable ecological and social regeneration on a global scale.

data.title: October Hypercerts Workshop
data.description:
Host a workshop to help support and grow the Hypercerts protocol.

**Measurable Outcome**

- Community feedback and comments about workshop
- Workshop guide to assist workshop attendees
- Workshop recording
- Have at least 20 guests attend

data.reason:
On October 3rd we hosted a Hypercerts Workshop for the Greenpill community on Google Meet. We collaborated with @bitbeckers.eth from the Hypercerts organization. The workshop consisted of three core sections: an overview of Hypercerts, a project mapping activity using Miro, and a live demonstration of minting and purchasing a Hypercert.

**Links**

- [Workshop Highlights](https://youtu.be/5zf9ynSXppE)
- [Workshop Guide](https://app.charmverse.io/greenpill-dev-guild/october-hypercerts-workshop-49761076582765296)

![Hypercerts Wworkshop Screenshot](https://cdn.charmverse.io/user-content/5e36d65b-e9d7-4667-b1c7-f551832414e3/77278c70-8f71-435c-9cf4-0e4c185f7806/Screenshot-2024-10-15-at-1.23.53-PM.png)

On October 3rd we hosted a Hypercerts Workshop for the Greenpill community on Google Meet. We collaborated with @bitbeckers.eth from the Hypercerts organization. The workshop consisted of three core sections: an overview of Hypercerts, a project mapping activity using Miro, and a live demonstration of minting and purchasing a Hypercert.

**Links**

- [Workshop Highlights](https://youtu.be/5zf9ynSXppE)
- [Workshop Guide](https://app.charmverse.io/greenpill-dev-guild/october-hypercerts-workshop-49761076582765296)

![Hypercerts Wworkshop Screenshot](https://cdn.charmverse.io/user-content/5e36d65b-e9d7-4667-b1c7-f551832414e3/77278c70-8f71-435c-9cf4-0e4c185f7806/Screenshot-2024-10-15-at-1.23.53-PM.png)

data.text: We are grateful to the Hypercerts Org for the opportunity to receive this funding and proud to have successfully completed our grant through the October workshop. It was an insightful experience from multiple perspectives—grant funder, evaluator, and impact creator. We began laying the groundwork for an impact framework that can add more value to Hypercerts. From the funder and evaluator side, we explored Hypercerts new marketplace and are excited to see its future development. We look forward to continued collaboration with the Hypercerts team as we grow our initiatives together!

data.name: Hypercerts
data.description:
This round aims to strengthen the Hypercerts Ecosystem to realize the vision of an interconnected impact funding network. We specifically want to support projects
1. that integrate hypercerts into existing funding platforms—similar to the hypercerts integration with Gitcoin,
2. that develop new applications like prize competitions leveraging the hypercerts infrastructure,
3. that build tooling to extent the functionality for multiple integrations and applications, such as Deresy to coordinate evaluators, or
4. that are tangible use cases piloting new functionalities, e.g. implementing retroactive funding rounds with hypercerts or using hyperboards.
